title: Tiltrotor propulsion system for an aircraft

events.title: Application filed by General Electric Co
Assigned to GENERAL ELECTRIC COMPANY
description: ASSIGNMENT OF ASSIGNORS INTEREST (SEE DOCUMENT FOR DETAILS).
Assignors: MURROW, KURT DAVID, CRABTREE, GLENN, VONDRELL, RANDY M., ZATORSKI, DAREK TOMASZ, POLAKOWSKI, MATTHEW RYAN

classifications.description: Aircraft capable of landing or taking-off vertically, e.g. vertical take-off and landing [VTOL] aircraft having its flight directional axis horizontal when grounded the lift during taking-off being created by free or ducted propellers or by blowers the propellers being tiltable relative to the fuselage
Influencing air flow over aircraft surfaces by affecting boundary layer flow by use of slot, ducts, porous areas or the like for sucking

Aircraft capable of landing or taking-off vertically, e.g. vertical take-off and landing [VTOL] aircraft having its flight directional axis horizontal when grounded the lift during taking-off being created by free or ducted propellers or by blowers the propellers being fixed relative to the fuselage
Aircraft characterised by the type or position of power plants of gas-turbine type  within, or attached to, fuselages
Aircraft characterised by the type or position of power plants of jet type within, or attached to, fuselages
Aircraft characterised by the type or position of power plants using steam or spring force
Aircraft characterised by electric power plants within, or attached to, wings
Power-plant nacelles, fairings or cowlings associated with fuselages
Power plant control systems; Arrangement of power plant control systems in aircraft for electric power plants for hybrid-electric power plants

Transmitting power from power plants to propellers or rotors; Arrangements of transmissions specially adapted for specific power plants for electric power plants of hybrid-electric type of series-parallel type

Transmitting power from power plants to propellers or rotors; Arrangements of transmissions specially adapted for specific power plants for electric power plants of hybrid-electric type of series type

Transmitting power from power plants to propellers or rotors; Arrangements of transmissions specially adapted for specific power plants for electric power plants the electric power plant being integral with the propeller or rotor
Rotary generators structurally associated with turbines or similar engines
Boundary layer controls by actively generating fluid flow
Aircraft characterised by the type or position of power plants comprising different types of power plants, e.g. combination of a piston engine and a gas-turbine
Efficient propulsion technologies, e.g. for aircraft

abstract: An aircraft includes a fuselage and a wing assembly attached to or formed integrally with the fuselage. The aircraft also includes a propulsion system having a port propulsor and a starboard propulsor. The port and starboard propulsors are each attached to the wing assembly on opposing sides of the fuselage and are rotatable between a forward thrust position and a vertical thrust position. The propulsion system also includes a supplemental propulsor mounted to the fuselage to provide certain efficiencies for the aircraft.
claims: 2. The aircraft of claim 1, wherein the supplemental fan is configured as a boundary layer ingestion fan mounted at the aft end of the fuselage.
3. The aircraft of claim 2, wherein the supplemental fan defines an inlet extending substantially 360° around the fuselage.

4. The aircraft of claim 1, wherein the propulsion system further comprises:
an electric generator; and
a combustion engine coupled to the electric generator for driving the electric generator, the electric generator configured to generate electrical power and provide such electric power to the port and starboard propulsors.
5. The aircraft of claim 4, wherein the port and starboard propulsors are each electric fans.
6. The aircraft of claim 4, wherein the combustion engine is mechanically coupled to the supplemental propulsor for driving the supplemental propulsor.
7. The aircraft of claim 6, wherein the propulsion system further comprises a gearbox, and wherein the combustion engine is mechanically coupled to the supplemental propulsor through the gearbox.

8. The aircraft of claim 6, wherein the propulsion system further comprises a coupling unit, and wherein the combustion engine is selectively mechanically coupled to the supplemental propulsor through the coupling unit.
9. The aircraft of claim 4, wherein the combustion engine is a turboshaft engine.

10. The aircraft of claim 1, wherein the thrust augmenter includes a plurality of outer nacelle extensions embedded within the outer nacelle when the thrust augmenter is in the forward thrust position.
11. The aircraft of claim 1, wherein the thrust augmenter includes a plurality of tail cone extensions embedded within the tail cone when the thrust augmenter is in the forward thrust position.
13. The propulsion system of claim 12, wherein the supplemental propulsor is configured as a ducted supplemental fan.

14. The propulsion system of claim 13, wherein the ducted supplemental fan is configured as a boundary layer ingestion fan configured to be mounted at an aft end of the fuselage and defining an inlet configured to extend substantially 360° around the fuselage.

15. The propulsion system of claim 12, wherein the supplemental propulsor is a ducted supplemental fan comprising an outer nacelle and a tail cone, wherein the supplemental propulsor comprises a thrust augmenter moveable between a forward thrust position and a vertical thrust position, and wherein the thrust augmenter is integrated into the outer nacelle, the tail cone, or both.
16. The propulsion system of claim 12, wherein the gearbox is a reduction gearbox for reducing a rotational speed of the supplemental propulsor relative to the combustion engine.

18. The aircraft of claim 17, wherein the supplemental propulsor is a ducted supplemental fan comprising an outer nacelle and a tail cone, wherein the supplemental propulsor further comprises a thrust augmenter moveable between a forward thrust position and a vertical thrust position, and wherein the thrust augmenter is integrated into the outer nacelle, the tail cone, or both.

19. An aircraft comprising:
a fuselage extending between a forward end and an aft end;
a wing assembly attached to or formed integrally with the fuselage; and
a propulsion system comprising
a port propulsor and a starboard propulsor, the port and starboard propulsors each attached to the wing assembly on opposing sides of the fuselage and rotatable between a forward thrust position and a vertical thrust position; and
a supplemental propulsor mounted to the fuselage, wherein the supplemental propulsor is a ducted supplemental fan comprising an outer nacelle and a tail cone, wherein the supplemental fan is configured as a boundary layer ingestion fan mounted at the aft end of the fuselage and defining an inlet extending substantially 360° around the fuselage, wherein the supplemental propulsor further comprises a thrust augmenter moveable between a forward thrust position and a vertical thrust position, and wherein the thrust augmenter is integrated into the outer nacelle, the tail cone, or both.

20. The aircraft of claim 17, wherein the forward wing assembly includes a port side and a starboard side, wherein the port side of the forward wing assembly includes a base fixed to the fuselage and a tilt section rotatable relative to the base, wherein the starboard side of the forward wing assembly includes a base fixed to the fuselage and a tilt section rotatable relative to the base, wherein the port forward propulsor is coupled to the tilt section of the port side of the forward wing assembly, and wherein the starboard forward propulsor is coupled to the tilt section of the starboard side of the forward wing assembly.
